Description: Ensures product quality specifications are in compliance with corporate/customers' standards and requirements. Establishes QA/QC policies and standards for product assessment, technical service, vendors evaluations, and off-shore QA/QC; oversees QA/QC team and vendors to implement and enforce corporate QA/QC policies. An Entry Professional (P1) applies broad theoretical job knowledge typically obtained through advanced education. May require the following proficiency: Work is closely supervised. Problems faced are not typically difficult or complex. Explains facts, policies and practices related to job area. Responsibilities: Being responsible for in incoming & in-process quality function of the HV line , have to interact with colleagues of various functions. Monitoring of the assembly process with respect to work instructions and other technical provisions. Capturing and analyzing the quality issues faced during assembly and testing of the product on regular basis and their resolution through CAPA and  DMAIC analysis. Basic Knowledge of Casting, Machining processes. Manufacturing Processes of Switchgear Components. Monitoring and maintenance of quality records ( i.e. traceability, calibration etc.). Preparation of NCR, RGA , their record maintenance and interaction with the suppliers for improvements. Final product certification using check sheets. Preparing and display monthly product quality data on the display board. Conducting process audit periodically. Coordinating the activities during internal and external audit. Quality clearance for all tested products in SAP/ERP. Coordinating with cross functional for issue resolution Live core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.
